/user.description: This endpoint allows retrieving or updating a given user by their user ID.

get.description: Return details of the user making the request

delete.description: Delete the user making the request

/user/keys.description: This endpoint allows interacting with the API keys for a given user.

get.summary: Get the list of user API keys
get.description: Retrieve a list of existing user API keys

/user/keys/{key_name}.description: This endpoint allows operations on a single API key for a given user.

post.summary: Create and return new API key
post.description: Create and return new API key

/user/oauth/clients.description: this endpoint allows listing the clients the current user has authorized

get.summary: Get the list of user OAuth Clients
get.description: Retrieve the list of OAuth Clients that a user has authorized

delete.summary: Delete the oauth client for the user
delete.description: Delete the oauth client for the user and revoke all access

/user/oauth/tokens.description: this endpoint allows listing the valid access tokens on the current user's account

get.summary: Get the list of user OAuth Access Tokens
get.description: Retrieve the list of valid OAuth Access Tokens on the current user's account

delete.summary: delete an access token for a third party app
delete.description: Expires the access token for a third party app

patch.summary: updates an access token for a third party app
patch.description: Updates partially the access token for a third party app

expires.description: expiration time of the token as a unix timestamp

/workspaces.description: This endpoint enables interacting with specific workspaces within Xata. For more information about workspaces, see the [docs](/concepts/workspaces).

get.description: Retrieve the list of workspaces the user belongs to

post.description: Creates a new workspace with the user requesting it as its single owner.

/workspaces/{workspace_id}.description: This endpoint contains operations for a specific workspace, referenced by ID.

get.description: Retrieve workspace info from a workspace ID

delete.description: Delete the workspace with the provided ID

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/members.description: This endpoint allows operations concerning the members of a given workspace.

get.summary: Get the list members of a workspace
get.description: Retrieve the list of members of the given workspace

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/members/{user.description: This endpoint enables operations on a specific member of a workspace, referenced by their user ID.

put.description: Update a workspace member role. Workspaces must always have at least one owner, so this operation will fail if trying to remove owner role from the last owner in the workspace.

delete.summary: Remove a member from the workspace
delete.description: Remove the member from the workspace

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/invites.description: This endpoint enables working with invites for a given workspace.

post.summary: Invite a user to join the workspace
post.description: Invite some user to join the workspace with the given role

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/invites/{invi.summary: A specific invite within a given workspace
/workspaces/{workspace_id}/invites/{invi.description: This endpoint enables working with a given invite.

patch.description: This operation provides a way to update an existing invite. Updates are performed in-place; they do not change the invite link, the expiry time, nor do they re-notify the recipient of the invite.

delete.description: This operation provides a way to cancel invites by deleting them. Already accepted invites cannot be deleted.

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/invites/{invi.description: This [RPC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remote_procedure_call)-style endpoint accepts a given invite to join a workspace.

post.summary: Accept the invitation to join a workspace
post.description: Accept the invitation to join a workspace. If the operation succeeds the user will be a member of the workspace

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/invites/{invi.description: Resend the notification for a previously generated Invite.

post.description: This operation provides a way to resend an Invite notification. Invite notifications can only be sent for Invites not yet accepted.

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/dbs.description: This path contains operations that can be performed on databases within Xata.

get.description: List all databases available in your Workspace.

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/dbs/{db_name}.description: Given a parameter `db_name`, this path allows interacting with a specific database on Xata. Below are a number of operations that can be performed on a given database.

delete.description: Delete a database and all of its branches and tables permanently.

get.description: Retrieve metadata of the given database

patch.description: Update the color of the selected database

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/dbs/{db_name}.description: Given a parameter `db_name`, this path allows you to rename your Xata database. When you rename a database all URLs accessing the database have to be updated.

post.description: Change the name of an existing database

/workspaces/{workspace_id}/regions.description: This path allows to access the list of available database regions

get.description: List regions available to create a database on

/db/{db_branch_name}/pgroll/apply.description: Apply a pgroll migration to the specified database

post.description: Applies a pgroll migration to the specified database.

/db/{db_branch_name}/pgroll/status.description: Get the pgroll status for the specified database

/dbs/{db_name}.description: Given a parameter `db_name`, this path allows interacting with a specific database on Xata. Below are a number of operations that can be performed on a given database.

/db/{db_branch_name}.description: This path allows interacting with a given database branch, referenced by parameter `db_branch_name`, which is expected in the format `database_name:branch_name`.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Name of source branch to branch the new schema from

from.description: Select the branch to fork from. Defaults to 'main'

delete.description: Delete the branch in the database and all its resources

/db/{db_branch_name}/metadata.description: This path allows interacting with the metadata of a specific database branch.

/db/{db_branch_name}/stats.description: This endpoint presents a number of statistics on a given database's branch.

/dbs/{db_name}/gitBranches.summary: Mapping of git to Xata branches
/dbs/{db_name}/gitBranches.description: This path allows managing the mapping between git and Xata branches, which is used by the `/dbs/{db_name}/resolveBranch` endpoint to resolve git branches to the associated Xata branches.

post.summary: Link a git branch to a Xata branch

gitBranch.description: The name of the Git branch.

xataBranch.description: The name of the Xata branch.

example.warning: Git branch [fix/bug123] was already present in the mapping and was overwritten.

delete.summary: Unlink a git branch to a Xata branch
delete.description:
Removes an entry from the mapping of git branches to Xata branches. The name of the git branch must be passed as a query parameter. If the git branch is not found, the endpoint returns a 404 status code.

Example request:

```json
// DELETE https://tutorial-ng7s8c.xata.sh/dbs/demo/gitBranches?gitBranch=fix%2Fbug123
```

parameters.name: gitBranch
parameters.description: The Git Branch to remove from the mapping

404.description: The git branch was not found in the mapping

/dbs/{db_name}/resolveBranch.description: This endpoint is typically used by the Xata SDKs to resolve the correct branch to use in a particular situation. The main input is the git branch.

get.summary: Resolve a Git Branch to a Xata branch
get.description:
In order to resolve the database branch, the following algorithm is used:
* if the `gitBranch` was provided and is found in the [git branches mapping](/api-reference/dbs/db_name/gitBranches), the associated Xata branch is returned
* else, if a Xata branch with the exact same name as `gitBranch` exists, return it
* else, if `fallbackBranch` is provided and a branch with that name exists, return it
* else, return the default branch of the DB (`main` or the first branch)

Example call:

```json
// GET https://tutorial-ng7s8c.xata.sh/dbs/demo/dbs/demo/resolveBranch?gitBranch=test&fallbackBranch=tsg
```

Example response:

```json
{
  "branch": "main",
  "reason": {
    "code": "DEFAULT_BRANCH",
    "message": "Default branch for this database (main)"
  }
}
```

/db/{db_branch_name}/migrations.description: This path allows access to migrations on a given database branch.

/db/{db_branch_name}/migrations/plan.description: This endpoint enables creating a migration plan for a given database branch.

post.description: Compute a migration plan from a target schema the branch should be migrated too.

/db/{db_branch_name}/migrations/execute.description: This endpoint is called in the style of an RPC (Remote Procedure Call) when a migration is to be executed against a specific database.

post.description: Apply a migration plan to the branch

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/history.description: Query the branch its schema history.

after.description: Query the next page that follow the cursor.

before.description: Query the previous page before the cursor.

size.description: Set page size. If the size is missing it is read from the cursor. If no cursor is given xata will choose the default page size.

since.description: Report only migrations that have been added since the given Migration ID.

more.description: true if more records can be fetch

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/compare.description: Compare the branch schema with a custom provided schema.

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/compare/{bra.description: Compare the schema of any 2 branches.

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/update.description: Update the branch schema with migration operations

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/preview.description: Preview the resulting branch schema when applying the edit script.

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/apply.summary: Update Branch schema with edit script.
/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/apply.description: Update the branch from schema edit script.

/db/{db_branch_name}/schema/push.description: Apply a list of migrations to the current branch.

post.description:
The `schema/push` API accepts a list of migrations to be applied to the
current branch. A list of applicable migrations can be fetched using
the `schema/history` API from another branch or database.

The most recent migration must be part of the list or referenced (via
`parentID`) by the first migration in the list of migrations to be pushed.

Each migration in the list has an `id`, `parentID`, and `checksum`. The
checksum for migrations are generated and verified by xata. The
operation fails if any migration in the list has an invalid checksum.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint provides a way to mutate a specific table on a database.

put.description: Creates a new table with the given name. Returns 422 if a table with the same name already exists.

delete.description: Deletes the table with the given name.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint enables reading or updating the schema of a given table.
This endpoint allows working with a table's columns.

get.description:
Retrieves the list of table columns and their definition. This endpoint returns the column list with object columns being reported with their
full dot-separated path (flattened).

post.description: Adds a new column to the table. The body of the request should contain the column definition.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint allows working with a single column from a given table.

get.description: Get the definition of a single column.

patch.description: Update column with partial data. Can be used for renaming the column by providing a new "name" field.

/db/{db_branch_name}/transaction.summary: Execute a transaction on a branch
/db/{db_branch_name}/transaction.description:
Executes multiple operations together as one. This allows you to run a number of 
operations that succeed as a single group; or fail with no changes to your database.

post.summary: Execute a transaction on a branch

200.description: Returns the results of a successful transaction.

400.description: Returns errors from a failed transaction.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint enables mutating data into a given database table. To query data, please see the [query endpoint](query).

post.description: Insert a new Record into the Table

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: File array access endpoint allows upload, download and remove of file items.

get.summary: Download content from a file item in a file array column
get.description: Retrieves file content from an array by file ID

put.summary: Upload or update the content of a file item in a file array column
put.description: Uploads the file content to an array given the file ID

delete.summary: Delete an item from a file array
delete.description: Deletes an item from an file array column given the file ID

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: File access endpoint allows upload and download of binary file content.

get.summary: Download content from a file column
get.description: Retrieves the file content from a file column

put.summary: Upload content to a file column
put.description: Uploads the file content to the given file column

delete.summary: Remove the content from a file column
delete.description: Deletes a file referred in a file column

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint enables mutating a given record in a table, referenced by its ID.

put.description: By default, IDs are auto-generated when data is insterted into Xata. Sending a request to this endpoint allows us to insert a record with a pre-existing ID, bypassing the default automatic ID generation.

post.description: Bulk insert records

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint serves data from a given table, inside a specific database's branch.

consistency.description: The consistency level for this request.

/db/{db_branch_name}/search.description:
This endpoint performs full text search across an entire database branch. You can filter down to  particular
table by using the `tables` parameter. The `tables` parameter accepts a mixed array of strings and objects. Using a string (the table name) selects the full table. Using an object allows one to specify a filter as well. The supported filters are the same as documented for the [query endpoint](/api-reference/db/db_branch_name/tables/table_name/) with the following exceptions:
* filters `$contains`, `$startsWith`, `$endsWith` don't work on columns of type `text`
* filtering on columns of type `multiple` is currently unsupported

post.description: Run a free text search operation across the database branch.

tables.description: An array with the tables in which to search. By default, all tables are included. Optionally, filters can be included that apply to each table.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint performs full text search in a particular table.

post.summary: Free text search in a table
post.description:
Run a free text search operation in a particular table.

The endpoint accepts a `query` parameter that is used for the free text search and a set of structured filters (via the `filter` parameter) that are applied before the search. The `filter` parameter uses the same syntax as the [query endpoint](/api-reference/db/db_branch_name/tables/table_name/) with the following exceptions:
* filters `$contains`, `$startsWith`, `$endsWith` don't work on columns of type `text`
* filtering on columns of type `multiple` is currently unsupported

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: This endpoint can be used to perform vector-based similarity searches.

post.summary: Vector similarity search in a table
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to perform vector-based similarity searches in a table. 
It can be used for implementing semantic search and product recommendation. To use this
endpoint, you need a column of type vector. The input vector must have the same
dimension as the vector column.

queryVector.description:
The vector to search for similarities. Must have the same dimension as
the vector column used.

column.description: The vector column in which to search. It must be of type `vector`.

similarityFunction.description:
The function used to measure the distance between two points. Can be one of:
`cosineSimilarity`, `l1`, `l2`. The default is `cosineSimilarity`.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.summary: Ask data in your table a question
/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: Ask your table a question and have Xata answer.

post.description: Ask your table a question. If the `Accept` header is set to `text/event-stream`, Xata will stream the results back as SSE's.

question.description: The question you'd like to ask.

searchType.description:
The type of search to use. If set to `keyword` (the default), the search can be configured by passing
a `search` object with the following fields. For more details about each, see the Search endpoint documentation.
All fields are optional.
  * fuzziness  - typo tolerance
  * target - columns to search into, and weights.
  * prefix - prefix search type.
  * filter - pre-filter before searching.
  * boosters - control relevancy.
If set to `vector`, a `vectorSearch` object must be passed, with the following parameters. For more details, see the Vector
Search endpoint documentation. The `column` and `contentColumn` parameters are required.
  * column - the vector column containing the embeddings.
  * contentColumn - the column that contains the text from which the embeddings where computed.
  * filter - pre-filter before searching.

column.description: The column to use for vector search. It must be of type `vector`.

contentColumn.description: The column containing the text for vector search. Must be of type `text`.

answer.description: The answer to the input question

sessionId.description: The session ID for the chat session.

answer.description: The answer to the input question

records.description: The IDs of the records that were used as context.

sessionId.description: The session ID for the chat session.

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.summary: Ask follow-up questions of your data
/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description: Continue a conversation with your data. This endpoint lets you continue a question started via the /ask endpoint in order to dive deeper into your context or ask clarifying questions.

post.summary: Continue a conversation with your data
post.description: Ask a follow-up question. If the `Accept` header is set to `text/event-stream`, Xata will stream the results back as SSE's.

message.description: The question you'd like to ask.

answer.description: The answer to the input question
The answer to the input question

/db/{db_branch_name}/tables/{table_name}.description:
This endpoint summarizes from your database. It comes with a range
of functions to help perform calculations on the data you have stored
in your tables

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to (optionally) define groups, and then to run
calculations on the values in each group. This is most helpful when 
you'd like to understand the data you have in your database.

A group is a combination of unique values. If you create a group for 
`sold_by`, `product_name`, we will return one row for every combination 
of `sold_by` and `product_name` you have in your database. When you 
want to calculate statistics, you define these groups and ask Xata to 
calculate data on each group.

**Some questions you can ask of your data:**

How many records do I have in this table?
- Set `columns: []` as we we want data from the entire table, so we ask
for no groups.
- Set `summaries: {"total": {"count": "*"}}` in order to see the count 
of all records. We use `count: *` here we'd like to know the total 
amount of rows; ignoring whether they are `null` or not.

What are the top total sales for each product in July 2022 and sold 
more than 10 units?
- Set `filter: {soldAt: {
  "$ge": "2022-07-01T00:00:00.000Z", 
  "$lt": "2022-08-01T00:00:00.000Z"}
}` 
in order to limit the result set to sales recorded in July 2022.
- Set `columns: [product_name]` as we'd like to run calculations on 
each unique product name in our table. Setting `columns` like this will 
produce one row per unique product name.
- Set `summaries: {"total_sales": {"count": "product_name"}}` as we'd 
like to create a field called "total_sales" for each group. This field 
will count all rows in each group with non-null product names.
- Set `sort: [{"total_sales": "desc"}]` in order to bring the rows with 
the highest total_sales field to the top.
- Set `summariesFilter: {"total_sales": {"$ge": 10}}` to only send back data 
with greater than or equal to 10 units.

`columns`: tells Xata how to create each group. If you add `product_id` 
we will create a new group for every unique `product_id`.

`summaries`: tells Xata which calculations to run on each group. Xata
currently supports count, min, max, sum, average.

`sort`: tells Xata in which order you'd like to see results. You may 
sort by fields specified in `columns` as well as the summary names 
defined in `summaries`.

note: Sorting on summarized values can be slower on very large tables; 
this will impact your rate limit significantly more than other queries. 
Try use `filter` to reduce the amount of data being processed in order 
to reduce impact on your limits.

`summariesFilter`: tells Xata how to filter the results of a summary. 
It has the same syntax as `filter`, however, by using `summariesFilter`
you may also filter on the results of a query.

note: This is a much slower to use than `filter`. We recommend using 
`filter` wherever possible and `summariesFilter` when it's not 
possible to use `filter`.

`page.size`: tells Xata how many records to return. If unspecified, Xata
will return the default size.

consistency.description: The consistency level for this request.

size.description:
The number of records returned by summarize. If the amount of data you have exceeds this, or you have
more complex reporting requirements, we recommend that you use the aggregate endpoint instead.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to run aggregations (analytics) on the data from one table.
While the summary endpoint is served from a transactional store and the results are strongly 
consistent, the aggregate endpoint is served from our columnar store and the results are 
only eventually consistent. On the other hand, the aggregate endpoint uses a 
store that is more appropiate for analytics, makes use of approximative algorithms 
(e.g for cardinality), and is generally faster and can do more complex aggregations.

For usage, see the [API Guide](https://xata.io/docs/api-guide/aggregate).

/db/{db_branch_name}/sql.description: This endpoint performs the SQL query across the entire database branch. Set your SQL query in the parameter `query`.

post.description: Run an SQL query across the database branch.

consistency.description: The consistency level for this request.

InviteKeyParam.name: invite_key
InviteKeyParam.description: Invite Key (secret) for the invited user

AggExpression.description:
The description of a single aggregation operation. It is an object with only one key-value pair.
The key represents the aggregation type, while the value is an object with the configuration of
the aggregation.

AggExpressionMap.description: The description of the aggregations you wish to receive.

AverageAgg.description: The average of the numeric values in a particular column.

column.description: The column on which to compute the average. Must be a numeric type.

CountAgg.description: Count the number of records with an optional filter.

oneOf.description: Use this form to count all records without any filter.

DBBranchName.title: Tuple of database and branch name

DatabaseGithubSettings.description: Github repository settings for this database (optional)

name.description: The machine-readable name of a database

region.description: Region where this database is hosted

createdAt.description: The time this database was created

ui.description: Metadata about the database for display in Xata user interfaces

color.description: The user-selected color for this database across interfaces

DateBooster.description:
Boost records based on the value of a datetime column. It is configured via "origin", "scale", and "decay". The further away from the "origin",
the more the score is decayed. The decay function uses an exponential function. For example if origin is "now", and scale is 10 days and decay is 0.5, it
should be interpreted as: a record with a date 10 days before/after origin will be boosted 2 times less than a record with the date at origin.
The result of the exponential function is a boost between 0 and 1. The "factor" allows you to control how impactful this boost is, by multiplying it with a given value.

column.description: The column in which to look for the value.

origin.description:
The datetime (formatted as RFC3339) from where to apply the score decay function. The maximum boost will be applied for records with values at this time.
If it is not specified, the current date and time is used.

scale.description: The duration at which distance from origin the score is decayed with factor, using an exponential function. It is formatted as number + units, for example: `5d`, `20m`, `10s`.

decay.description: The decay factor to expect at "scale" distance from the "origin".

factor.description: The factor with which to multiply the added boost.

ifMatchesFilter.description: Only apply this booster to the records for which the provided filter matches.

DateHistogramAgg.description: Split data into buckets by a datetime column. Accepts sub-aggregations for each bucket.

column.description: The column to use for bucketing. Must be of type datetime.

interval.description:
The fixed interval to use when bucketing. 
It is formatted as number + units, for example: `5d`, `20m`, `10s`.

calendarInterval.description:
The calendar-aware interval to use when bucketing. Possible values are: `minute`,
`hour`, `day`, `week`, `month`, `quarter`, `year`.

timezone.description:
The timezone to use for bucketing. By default, UTC is assumed.
The accepted format is as an ISO 8601 UTC offset. For example: `+01:00` or
`-08:00`.

FuzzinessExpression.description:
Maximum [Levenshtein distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance) for the search terms. The Levenshtein
distance is the number of one character changes needed to make two strings equal. The default is 1, meaning that single
character typos per word are tolerated by search. You can set it to 0 to remove the typo tolerance or set it to 2
to allow two typos in a word.

enabled.description: Set to `false` to disable highlighting. By default it is `true`.

encodeHTML.description: Set to `false` to disable HTML encoding in highlight snippets. By default it is `true`.

enablePublicUrl.description: Enable public access to the file

signedUrlTimeout.description: Time to live for signed URLs

InputFileEntry.description: Object representing a file in an array

enablePublicUrl.description: Enable public access to the file

signedUrlTimeout.description: Time to live for signed URLs

databases.description: A list of databases in a Xata workspace

regions.description: A list of regions where databases can be created

MaxAgg.description: The max of the numeric values in a particular column.

column.description: The column on which to compute the max. Must be a numeric type.

closedAt.description: Timestamp when the migration request was closed.

mergedAt.description: Timestamp when the migration request was merged.

body.description: The migration request body with detailed description.

MinAgg.description: The min of the numeric values in a particular column.

column.description: The column on which to compute the min. Must be a numeric type.

NumericBooster.description: Boost records based on the value of a numeric column.

column.description: The column in which to look for the value.

factor.description: The factor with which to multiply the value of the column before adding it to the item score.

modifier.description:
Modifier to be applied to the column value, before being multiplied with the factor. The possible values are:
  - none (default).
  - log: common logarithm (base 10)
  - log1p: add 1 then take the common logarithm. This ensures that the value is positive if the
    value is between 0 and 1.
  - ln: natural logarithm (base e)
  - ln1p: add 1 then take the natural logarithm. This ensures that the value is positive if the
    value is between 0 and 1.
  - square: raise the value to the power of two.
  - sqrt: take the square root of the value.
  - reciprocal: reciprocate the value (if the value is `x`, the reciprocal is `1/x`).

ifMatchesFilter.description: Only apply this booster to the records for which the provided filter matches.

NumericHistogramAgg.description: Split data into buckets by dynamic numeric ranges. Accepts sub-aggregations for each bucket.

column.description: The column to use for bucketing. Must be of numeric type.

interval.description:
The numeric interval to use for bucketing. The resulting buckets will be ranges 
with this value as size.

offset.description:
By default the bucket keys start with 0 and then continue in `interval` steps. The bucket
boundaries can be shifted by using the offset option. For example, if the `interval` is 100,
but you prefer the bucket boundaries to be `[50, 150), [150, 250), etc.`, you can set `offset` 
to 50.

after.description: Query the next page that follow the cursor.

before.description: Query the previous page before the cursor.

start.description: Query the first page from the cursor.

end.description: Query the last page from the cursor.

size.description: Set page size. If the size is missing it is read from the cursor. If no cursor is given Xata will choose the default page size.

offset.description: Use offset to skip entries. To skip pages set offset to a multiple of size.

PercentilesAgg.description: Calculate given percentiles of the numeric values in a particular column.

column.description: The column on which to compute the average. Must be a numeric type.

status.description: The status of the most recent migration

version.description: The name of the most recent version

PrefixExpression.description: If the prefix type is set to "disabled" (the default), the search only matches full words. If the prefix type is set to "phrase", the search will return results that match prefixes of the search phrase.

ProjectionConfig.description: A structured projection that allows for some configuration.

name.description: The name of the column to project or a reverse link specification, see [API Guide](https://xata.io/docs/concepts/data-model#links-and-relations).

as.description: An alias for the projected field, this is how it will be returned in the response.

version.description: The record's version. Can be used for optimistic concurrency control.

createdAt.description: The time when the record was created.

updatedAt.description: The time when the record was last updated.

table.description: The record's table name. APIs that return records from multiple tables will set this field accordingly.

highlight.description: Highlights of the record. This is used by the search APIs to indicate which fields and parts of the fields have matched the search.

score.description: The record's relevancy score. This is returned by the search APIs.

more.description: true if more records can be fetched

size.description: the number of records returned per page

SearchPageConfig.description: Pagination settings for the search endpoints.

offset.description: Use offset to skip entries. To skip pages set offset to a multiple of size.

SearchPageConfig.title: SearchPageConfig

SumAgg.description: The sum of the numeric values in a particular column.

column.description: The column on which to compute the sum. Must be a numeric type.

SummaryExpression.description:
A summary expression is the description of a single summary operation. It consists of a single
key representing the operation, and a value representing the column to be operated on.

The column being summarized cannot be an internal column (id, xata.*), nor the base of
an object, i.e. if `settings` is an object with `dark_mode` as a field, you may summarize
`settings.dark_mode` but not `settings` nor `settings.*`.

We currently support several aggregation functions. Not all functions can be run on all column
types.

  - `count` is used to count the number of records in each group. Use `{"count": "*"}` to count
    all columns present, otherwise `{"count": "<column_path>"}` to count the number of non-null
    values are present at column path.

    Count can be used on any column type, and always returns an int.

  - `min` calculates the minimum value in each group. `min` is compatible with most types;
    string, multiple, text, email, int, float, and datetime. It returns a value of the same
    type as operated on. This means that `{"lowest_latency": {"min": "latency"}}` where
    `latency` is an int, will always return an int.

  - `max` calculates the maximum value in each group. `max` shares the same compatibility as
    `min`.

  - `sum` adds up all values in a group. `sum` can be run on `int` and `float` types, and will
    return a value of the same type as requested.

  - `average` averages all values in a group. `average` can be run on `int` and `float` types, and
    always returns a float.

SummaryExpressionList.description:
The description of the summaries you wish to receive. Set each key to be the field name
you'd like for the summary. These names must not collide with other columns you've
requested from `columns`; including implicit requests like `settings.*`.

The value for each key needs to be an object. This object should contain one key and one 
value only. In this object, the key should be set to the summary function you wish to use
and the value set to the column name to be summarized.

The column being summarized cannot be an internal column (id, xata.*), nor the base of
an object, i.e. if `settings` is an object with `dark_mode` as a field, you may summarize
`settings.dark_mode` but not `settings` nor `settings.*`.

TargetExpression.description: The target expression is used to filter the search results by the target columns.

TopValuesAgg.description:
Split data into buckets by the unique values in a column. Accepts sub-aggregations for each bucket.
The top values as ordered by the number of records (`$count`) are returned.

column.description: The column to use for bucketing. Accepted types are `string`, `email`, `int`, `float`, or `bool`.

size.description: The maximum number of unique values to return.

TransactionDeleteOp.description: A delete operation. The transaction will continue if no record matches the ID by default. To override this behaviour, set failIfMissing to true.

failIfMissing.description: If true, the transaction will fail when the record doesn't exist.

columns.description: If set, the call will return the requested fields as part of the response.

TransactionError.description: An error message from a failing transaction operation

index.description: The index of the failing operation

TransactionFailure.description: An array of errors, with indices, from the transaction.

errors.description: An array of errors from the submitted operations.

columns.description: If set, the call will return the requested fields as part of the response.

record.description: The record to insert. The `id` field is optional; when specified, it will be used as the ID for the record.

ifVersion.description:
The version of the record you expect to be overwriting. Only valid with an
explicit ID is also set in the `record` key.

createOnly.description:
createOnly is used to change how Xata acts when an explicit ID is set in the `record` key. 

If `createOnly` is set to `true`, Xata will only attempt to insert the record. If there's a conflict, Xata 
will cancel the transaction. 

If `createOnly` is set to `false`, Xata will attempt to insert the record. If there's no
conflict, the record is inserted. If there is a conflict, Xata will replace the record.

columns.description: If set, the call will return the requested fields as part of the response.

TransactionResultColumns.description: Fields to return in the transaction result.

TransactionResultDelete.description: A result from a delete operation.

operation.description: The type of operation who's result is being returned.

TransactionResultGet.description: A result from a get operation.

operation.description: The type of operation who's result is being returned.

TransactionResultInsert.description: A result from an insert operation.

operation.description: The type of operation who's result is being returned.

TransactionResultUpdate.description: A result from an update operation.

operation.description: The type of operation who's result is being returned.

TransactionSuccess.description: An ordered array of results from the submitted operations.

fields.description: The fields of the record you'd like to update

ifVersion.description: The version of the record you expect to be updating

upsert.description: Xata will insert this record if it cannot be found.

columns.description: If set, the call will return the requested fields as part of the response.

UniqueCountAgg.description: Count the number of distinct values in a particular column.

column.description: The column from where to count the unique values.

precisionThreshold.description:
The threshold under which the unique count is exact. If the number of unique
values in the column is higher than this threshold, the results are approximate.
Maximum value is 40,000, default value is 3000.

ValueBooster.description: Boost records with a particular value for a column.

column.description: The column in which to look for the value.

factor.description: The factor with which to multiply the added boost.

ifMatchesFilter.description: Only apply this booster to the records for which the provided filter matches.

BulkError.description: Response with multiple errors of the bulk execution

columns.description: Name of the column and its PostgreSQL type

SchemaUpdateResponse.description: Schema migration response with ID and migration status.

totalCount.description: The total count of records matched. It will be accurately returned up to 10000 records.

schema.description: Number of seconds to wait after retrying the operation

tags.name: Search and Filter
tags.description: APIs for searching, querying, filtering, and aggregating records.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: CRUD API for operating on binary content in file and file[] columns.
